newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek shares stuck in range, seen holding.
newsitem.headline: Greek shares stuck in range, seen holding.

text.p: Greek stocks were rangebound in early Wednesday trade with market watchers saying the market was coming to a standstill ahead of the Greek Easter holiday as investors were cautious over the course of macroeconomic indicators.

"Investors are getting lazy ahead of the Easter recess. The market shall be calm for a brief period before new information on macroeconomic indicators has an impact," said analyst Tasos Rapakoulias at Katsoulis Securities.
"Prices already reflect all positive developments and my only concern is over the extent of the drop of CPI-inflation below 6.0 percent in April and the slow growth of fiscal revenues," he added.
Recent rallies in major international stock markets were not expected to have positive percussions on the Athens bourse, brokers said.
"I would not count on New York's rise for an appreciation in Athens. In fact, past experience has shown that shock waves from foreign markets hit Greece only during bear trends," said Rapakoulias.
The theme of the day in Athens is the financial performance of industrial blue chips Silver & Baryte and Heracles Cement.

"The day has started with a set of adverse news on two large industrial stocks. Concerns over the impact on Silver & Baryte's bottom line after the recent merger with affiliated Bauxite Parnass are vindicated," said John Tegopoulos, analyst with Midland-Pantelakis Securities.
"Heracles Cement's profit growth is wiped out on a consolidated level by the performance of recently acquired Chalkis Cement," he added.
Silver & Baryte hit a low of 4,186 drachmas shortly after trading commenced, while Heracles Cement started weak also.
Other analysts said Silver & Baryte's large provisions were a temporary phenomenon and would not affect long-term prospects.
"A dividend per share of 140 drachmas for 1996 is going to reward its investors. Profit growth will resume very soon," said Rapakoulias.
The Athens general share index was 0.03 percent higher at 1,433.17 from Tuesday's 1,432.97 close after 40 minutes of trade.
Turnover amounted to 2.9 billion drachmas on 1.05 million shares traded. Advancers led decliners 79 to 70 with 29 stocks unchanged on 178 traded.
The Merrill Lynch call spread warrant on OTE with a strike price of 3,800 drachmas was quoted unchanged at 1,081.0 - 1,111.0. Shares of OTE telecom, the underlying, were flat at 6,150 drachmas.

The ING Baring Financial Products American style call warrant based on a basket of six bank stocks was quoted lower at $60.60-$62.21. The strike price is set at $99.60 and the warrants expire October 8, 1997.
The ING Baring Financial Products American- style call warrant on a basket of six blue-chips denominated in drachmas was quoted lower at 2,090-2,284 drachmas.
The strike price is set at 10,000 drachmas and the warrants expire on February 2, 1998.

The recently launched ING Baring American-style second call warrant on a basket of six bank stocks was quoted lower at $12.57-N/O. The strike price is set at $110.0 and the warrants expire April 9 1998.
